Source: Karen Maihofer of Creative Cuisine

dessert

Spiced Tahitian Vanilla Pecans

Servings varied

Time 50m

Difficulty

Ingredients

  • 1 pound large pecans
  • 1/2 cup sugar
  • 2 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil
  • 1 piece of Tahitian vanilla bean (4-inch long), cut into 1-inch pieices and split
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
  • 1/4 teaspoon allspice
  • 1/4 teaspoon coriander
  • 1/8 teaspoon black pepper

Instructions

  1. Blanch pecans in boiling water for 1 minute. Drain well.

  2. While still hot, put in bowl and toss with sugar and vegetable oil. Let stand 10 minutes. Place on jellyroll pan and bake at 325Â°F for 30 minutes, turning every 10 minutes until nuts are light brown and crispy.

  3. Pulverize spices and vanilla bean together in a mini food processor or electric coffee grinder.

  4. Remove pecans from pan to bowl and toss with spices and vanilla bean. Spread to cool. Store airtight. Can be frozen.
